data.content:
• ON24 REST API
  • ››Registration
  • ››Seamless Registration
  • ››Seamless Registration Engagement Hub and Target

 

Seamless Registration Engagement Hub and Target

Seamless Registration is a service for pushing registrant data to Elite. This service supports both the GET and POST HTTP methods.

 

Parameter Notes

Below you’ll find the fields that can be passed to the ON24 registration database. Please note the following:

  • The parameter names are case-sensitive.
  • You may have changed the display label of the field, but the underlying parameter name is always retained and should be referenced when passing registration data to ON24.
  • Associate the fields with the correct parameter name (e.g. pass the attendee’s first name in the "firstname" field rather than in some other field).
  • If the data you want to store is not in one of the named demographic fields, use the custom fields std1-std10.
  • Any values sent which exceed the designated character limit will be truncated.
  • Records containing the email address of a registrant who is already in the database will be updated with the latest values being sent depending on updateIfExist parameter value (see below).
  • The Ehub or Target unique eventId and key parameters must be included regardless of the method you use to send the Registrant data. These values are contained within the Seamless Registration URL.

 

Parameters

Parameter Name

Maximum Characters

Comments

firstName

100

 

lastName

100

 

company

100

  

*email

 100

 

extEventUserCd

100

 

jobTitle

100

 

address1

100

 

address2

100

 

city

100

 

state

100

 

zip

100

 

country

100

 

workPhone

100

 

industry

100

 

partnerRef

100

 

jobFunction

100

companySize

100

 

std1

100

 

std2

100

 

std3

100

 

std4

100

 

std5

100

 

std6

100

 

std7

100

 

std8

100

 

std9

100

 

std10

100

 

updateIfExist

N/A

Accepts Y or N as value with default being N

If Y, the user field values are updated if user (email) already exists.
isBlocked N/A

Passing isBlocked=Y with updateIfExist=Y will block the registered users.
experienceId 10  Experience Id is required for registration to an experience page.  Not applicable for Engagement Hub registration.

targetUrl

 N/A

Case-1: If 'targetUrl' parameter is not present
Output: User will not be redirected to any page after registration

Case-2: If 'targetUrl' parameter is present but no value is being passed
Output: User will be redirected to Engagement Hub or Experience page

Case-3: If 'targetUrl' parameter is present with value being passed
Output: User will be redirected to the page specified by the user

 

HTTP GET Method

The GET method relies on JavaScript redirection, which requires a web browser. This method will fail if used for server-to-server requests.

  • If any of the parameters include the SPACE character, it must be defined using URL encoding i.e. " ", (eg, &country=United States). Some special characters embedded within the field values, like "=", "&" etc., should also always be encoded.
  • It is recommended that you add the deletecookie=true parameter to avoid issues with users regsitering for the same event on one machine.
  • Example URL: https://gateway.on24.com/wcc/autoreg?eventId=XXXXXX&sessionid=1&key=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX&firstName=paul01252&lastName=test2&email=paul01252@paul.com&targetUrl=

 

HTTP POST Method

  • UTF input isn’t necessary if sending UTF-8, which is the default. If you’re sending characters using a different encoding, change the hidden value to the proper character set. For example, ISO-8859-1.
  • Example request:

<form name="myform" action="https://gateway.on24.com/wcc/autoreg" method="POST">

  <input type="hidden" name="eventId" value="XXXX">

  <input type="hidden" name="sessionid" value="1">

  <input type="hidden" name="key" value="XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX">

  <input type="text" name="firstName" value="john">

  <input type="text" name="lastName" value="smith">

  <input type="text" name="email" value="john.smith@abc.com">

  <input type="text" name="company" value="ABC, Inc.">

             <input type="hidden" name="targetUrl" value="">

  <input type="submit" value="Submit Form"/>

</form>

ON24 patents may apply – click here for more information.
